metatags.dc.description: Hurricane Florence made landfall at Wrightsville Beach on September 14, 2018, bringing deadly flash flooding and river flooding to large portions of the Carolinas. Locations impacted included Wilmington, Florence, Myrtle Beach, Lumberton, and Whiteville.

metatags.twitter:title: Viral photos of pigs drowning are not scenes from Hurricane Florence
metatags.og:title: Viral photos of pigs drowning are not scenes from Hurricane Florence
metatags.og:description: Photos of pigs reportedly drowning in North Carolina due to floods caused by Hurricane Florence are being shared on social media with misleading captions. While farm animals suffering or dying during floods is a real issue, the viral photos were taken in Vietnam in 2017, Iowa in 2008, and North Carolina in 1999.
metatags.twitter:creator: @afpfactuel

metatags.og:description: What could we learn from this tragedy if we focused, instead, on the millions of animals that had been excluded from the death toll and the massive farming systems that had kept them there? That was the question we came to ask.

metatags.og:description: At least 1.7 million chickens have died from flooding in the state. The impact is now coming into focus — including overflowing pools of hog manure and waterlogged sweet potato fields.
